title: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Viognier (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of white flowers, green herbs and peach. The flavors are tart and elegant in style, seeming quite watery in concentration.

title: Grayson 2015 Lot 6 Merlot (California)
description: This light-colored and light-bodied wine combines an earthy, metallic aroma with mildly fruity, candied flavors. Its texture is mild and smooth.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Castelo do Sulco Branco Colheita White (Lisboa)
description: The crisp Arinto and more perfumed Moscatel make an attractive pairing in this fruity wine. It has lemon and orange-zest flavors with a tangy, textured aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Solimar White (Vinho Verde)
description: This medium-dry wine has a crisp texture and light fizz on the tongue. It is bright and fruity, with some attractive citrus flavors. Drink now.

title: Lo Nuevo 2015 Covello Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon and apple aromas precede a high-acid citric palate without much elegance or finesse. This pedestrian Albariño deals pithy orange flavors that come with a note of grape skins. On the finish, this seems like orange juice.

title: Wetzel Estate 2012 Premier Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: High-toned aromatics complement aggressive, unintegrated flavors of raw wood. It's lumber, not toast, that you taste, along with bitter tannins and little evidence of ripe fruit.

title: Wetzel Estate 2012 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Flavors of dried herb cover dried fruit. It feels as if all the life has been drained from this wine. It should be consumed immediately.

title: Bota Box 2015 Riesling (California)
description: Slightly sweet and quite light in body, this wine has modest peach and herb aromas, generic fruit flavors and a soft texture.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2015 Protocolo Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Dusty aromas of chewing gum are a little strange, while this is chunky, creamy and a bit oily on the palate. Dry melon and papaya flavors are mild and finish with little to no oomph. Drink now or wait for the 2016 to appear in the spring.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Luzia de Ripa 2015  Txakoli de Álava
description: Cidery aromas are, at best, sturdy. This has shearing acidity along with an oily round mouthfeel. Sour stone-fruit and citrus flavors finish with lasting notes of tart green apple. This is a still Txakoli: don't expect spritz or bubbles.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)
description: This soft, easy wine offers attractive light tannins and crisp acidity. Its red-fruit flavors are ready to drink now.

title: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Berry, spice and raspberry Kool-Aid aromas set up an edgy feeling palate with hard tannins and a hollow middle. This is fruity but rough, with a finish that's raw, rubbery and tannic.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Raylee 2014 Terrabella Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: It's unusual to say the least to find such an inexpensive Pinot Noir made in a three barrel production. But here it is. Rough and tumble, with scents and flavors of pickle barrel and thin red fruits. Hints of apple cider vinegar come across, with a quick, chewy, tannic finish.

title: Del Rio 2013 Port Syrah (Rogue Valley)
description: A fortified wine made from 100% Syrah, this was aged for 30 months in neutral oak, yet remains disjointed and a bit puzzling. Green, tannic flavors are threaded with suggestions of raisined fruit, wet hay and bitter chocolate.

title: Château Kalon Nodoz 2014  Côtes de Bourg
description: The wine has layers of acidity that come from the underripe fruit. It has bell pepper and spice along with red currant fruitiness.

title: Alpamanta 2010 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Heavy raisin and prune aromas are inescapable. Plodding and overweight, this tastes like it smells, while the finish is raisiny. This strives for that lush style of Malbec, but it's short on balance.

title: AVA Grace Vineyards 2014 Red (California)
description: Light and smooth, this is an easy-to-drink, medium-bodied wine with flavors like cherry jelly and a soft texture.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2015 Maceración Carbonica  (Rioja)
description: Wiry slightly harsh and medicinal aromas of plum and berry are typical of a carbonic wine. Rubbery, chunky and grabby on the palate, this tastes of savory medicinal plum and raspberry. A limited finish ends abruptly.

title: Finca Adelma 2014 El Capitan Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Soupy, creamy black-fruit scents are smothered by heavy oak-based aromas of clove and resin. This is so thick and viscous that it feels greasy. Dominant flavors of clove and raw oak finish with notes of carob and mint.

title: Sanguinhal 2015 Cerejeiras Branco White (Lisboa)
description: This light and fruity wine includes the rare Vital in its blend, giving crispness and a bright texture that is filled out with Fernão Pires and Arinto. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Metodo Clássico Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)
description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, this crisp, yeasty wine is bright with apple flavors. It has a bite of pepper and toast as well as final acidity. Drink now.

title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2014  Médoc
description: The wine seems to have too much high-toast wood aging for its own good. This wood has masked the fruit and taken much of the richness of the wine. It could soften and broaden although it will probably remain too dry.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2012 in the Port Style Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The winemakers made a good run at this, blending six Pinot clones and fortifying with a Pinot Noir brandy. But the finished wine, when first opened, is a leafy, disjointed mix of flavors. Fruitcake, baking spices, wet leaves and some finishing heat don't quite come together. But if left alone for some days or even weeks, this might pull itself into shape.

title: Beacon Hill 2015 Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: As with the estate-grown Riesling, this fruit tastes sour, and falls a little flat in the mouth. Flavors hint at apple cider vinegar. It may or may not hold up for long—best to drink it over the next year.

title: Bodegas Lozano NV Añoranza 5.5 Frizzante Sparkling (Spain)
description: A mildly funky and sweaty nose is not uncommon for sweet sparklers such as this. Foamy and smooth on the palate, this tastes of lychee, honeydew and powdered sugar. A moderately fresh finish avoids being cloying.

title: François Lurton 2016 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Valle de Uco)
description: Sulfuric gritty aromas get in the way of fruit scents, which creates a compromised nose. This is spritzy in feel, and thus a bit off-putting. Dilute, slightly bitter and bland citrus flavors finish dry, with soda-like spritz.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2015 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Despite being the newest vintage, this smells oxidized and like briny apple. A lean palate ranks as bland, while flavors of sour apple and lemon peel finish tart and citric, with a lasting but discordant yeast-like flavor.

title: Finca Las Moras 2014 Barrel Select Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Leathery lightly herbaceous berry aromas are not overly ripe. In the mouth, this is scratchy on the surface but dilute below deck. Lightly weedy plum and berry flavors finish herbal and green.

title: Castorani 2013  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: This has aromas that recall cellar floor, nail polish remover and stewed prune. The sparse, diluted palate has mere suggestions of dried cherry alongside gritty fleeting tannins. It finishes on a bitter note.

title: Vivanco 2015 White (Rioja)
description: Chunky briny aromas are simply not that fresh. This mix of Viura, Tempranillo Blanco and Maturana Blanca is wide and shapeless. Pyrazinic flavors on this novelty blend suggest certain Sauvignon Blancs or Verdejo.
